alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 11:34PM EDT until August 12 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Johnston County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Wayne County in central North Carolina... * Until 245 AM EDT. * At 1134 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Goldsboro, Smithfield, Fremont, Micro, Selma, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Kenly, Princeton, Pikeville, Eureka and Nahunta. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
